detailedRequirements:
Overview

 

Greetings all, this is a "sister challenge" to our recent Android NFC Code Ideation. Our client is looking to test the ability to detect NFC signals from iOS phones across a distance. The use case for this is unique and they will not be using NFC in the typical way. The primary goal is to find ways to force an iOS device to generate different kinds of strong / sustained NFC signals. Communication via NFC is not important for this test - we simple need to generate a signal that can be detected, using an App.

 

We realize this may be particularly challenging with Apple / iOS (and perhaps not possible). However, we want to explore all the options and put the most creative minds to work on it :-)

 

Challenge Details

 

In this challenge we'd like you to create a simple iOS app which is able to run multiple "tests". Each test should exercise the NFC chip in a different way. The design of the app is up to you, the meaningful part of this challenge is to determine what kinds of NFC signals can be generated.

 

Additional Notes

 

This must be done in an App.

 

The application needs to run on current versions of iOS (9+).

 

In order to increase the chances for detection, we want to generate the strongest possible signal for the longest period of time (e.g. several seconds if possible).

 

"Tests" that require a second phone can be used, but we prefer solutions that can generate signal with a single phone.

 

Please include as many unique tests as possible (as long as they're are truly different from each other).

 

If there are ways to take advantage of lower level access to NFC hardware in particular phones, these would be valuable as well (please document the phone hardware requirements).

Bonus

 

We want to encourage different ways to think about this problem and different solutions. If your submission passes (> 80% review) and you have a unique idea / test (which no one else has submitted), you will be paid an additional $100 for each such idea. Assignment of this bonus award will be determined strictly by the project team.

 

Alternative Success Criteria

 

In order to encourage participation - if it turns out that engaging the NFC chip, in iOS, via an app is not possible - we will pay an alternative prize of $300 for the best idea on how to solve this problem (generating NFC signals from an iOS device which can be detected). This payment will be take place if the main challenge prize is not paid out (e.g. if there are no valid submissions achieving the desired result). The determination of the best idea will be subjective, and it will be made by the project team.
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Submission Guidelines

 

Submit your application as a zip file

Include a detailed discussion of each "test" in your submission

Include an installation / deployment guide

Include a brief video showing your solution running
